However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for.  At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar.  After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late.  The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view. The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for.  At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar. But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.
